Regardless of age, relictners look like ancient [dwarves](/Ancestries.aspx?ID=1) with deep wrinkles, sparse white hair, and decrepit forms. As their bodies degrade, so too do their surroundings, with even the finest architecture crumbling to ruins. **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14)): DC 35 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 33 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 30 [Relictner Eroder](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1882) **Source** [Book of the Dead](/Sources.aspx?ID=118) pg. 127 **Perception** +23; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), lair sense **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Dwarven](/Languages.aspx?ID=3), [Necril](/Languages.aspx?ID=20) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +25, [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4) +22, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +19, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +23, [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=17) +20 **Str** +7 **Dex** +2 **Con** +7 **Int** +4 **Wis** +5 **Cha** +1 **Lair Sense** ([detection](/Traits.aspx?ID=43), [divination](/Traits.aspx?ID=47), [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48)) The relictner bonds with a single structure they consider their lair, such as a house, temple, or ruin. A relictner is aware of any creature that enters the lair, and the direction and approximate distance to the creature. If the lair is destroyed, the relictner can bond with a new lair by residing within a structure they own or claim for 1 week. **Items** [broken](/Conditions.aspx?ID=2) [chain mail](/Armor.aspx?ID=9), [broken](/Conditions.aspx?ID=2) [dwarven war axe](/Weapons.aspx?ID=62) --- **AC** 32 **Fort** +25 **Ref** +18 **Will** +21 **HP** 265 ([negative healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=42)) **Consecration Vulnerability** A relictner in a place of worship dedicated to a non-evil deity or on sacred ground, such as an area blessed by [_sanctified ground_](/Spells.aspx?ID=265), is [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=35).
**Weathering Aura** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157)) 60 feet. The relictner radiates an aura of degradation. All objects in the area have their Hardness reduced by 10, to a minimum of 0, for as long as they remain in the aura and for 1 round after leaving it. The relictner can't deactivate this aura. --- **Speed** 20 feet **Melee** eroding touch +26 ([Unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199)), **Damage** 3d12+10 acid **Ranged** targeted collapse +21 ([Trip](/Traits.aspx?ID=196), [versatile piercing](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)), **Damage** 3d10+3 bludgeoning **Crumble** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157)) The relictner erodes an object within 30 feet, dealing 3d10 bludgeoning damage to it, with a DC 31 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save if the object is attended. **Death Gasp** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117)) The relictner draws in a deep breath and holds it, temporarily suspending their biological processes and becoming undead. The relictner gains the [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160) trait and becomes immune to bleed, [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), and [sleep](/Traits.aspx?ID=145). Any such effects the relictner is currently inflicted with are suspended but take effect again once they take a breath. Death Gasp lasts as long as the relictner [holds their breath](/Rules.aspx?ID=468) (up to 8 rounds). **Demolition** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65)) The relictner bellows in fury, causing the surrounding structure to collapse. All creatures in a 30-foot emanation take 8d10 bludgeoning damage from falling debris (DC 31 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). A creature that fails its save is knocked [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=31). The area becomes difficult terrain. The relictner can't use Demolition again for 1d4 rounds.
name: Relictner Eroder
